Posts.Content: I was 45 at the time of my first chemo. I was having slightly irregular periods. After my first chemo, I got my period earlier than expected, and that was it. I never had it again. Bloodwork was done which showed I was in menopause. At first my gyn wanted to give me medication which would bring on my period, but probably cause me to bleed heavily from not having periods for several months. I told my onc and she advised me not to do it. The hot flashes aren't as bad anymore, and I am on Arimidex. Jayne
Posts.Title: does chemo cause menopause

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, If anyone recalls my tumor markers have been steadily rising. Since last year. From 28 to now 120. They were 78 back in November. I had PETS, MRI CT and Bone scan, which showed nothing back in October. Now my onc is ordering the tests all over again. She sees no other reason for the rise other than disease coming back. I do have benign lesions in my liver that have grown, but are benign. She said that could possibly be the cause, she is unsure as she has never had any patients with benign liver growths and markers rising. She rarely does markers, only a handful of patients so she has nothing to go on there. I am scheduling the tests as soon as possible, but wonder if I should be seeing someone else, a major cancer center - just for an opinion. I know I must have asked before, but does anyone have rising markers as high as mine with no evidence of disease? Thanks so much, I am grasping at straws and pulling out my hair. Jayne
Posts.Title: TM's on the rise again :( Dont know what to think

Posts.Content: This messge is for Dr. Leo, Dr. Leo, can you offer me any info on this? I was dx with bc in 2001. So far, all ct scans, PETS, etc have been negative. I feel good. However, since the last year and a half my tm's have been slowly rising. They started out at 16 and have now risen to 75 back in August of 2004. I had ovarian cysts which are no longer there after my last pelvic US in November. My onc wants to repeat tm's in February. Could it possibly be the cysts which made them rise? My onc said she will order a bone marrow test if they continue to rise. I know other things cause them to go up, but they have steadily risen over the past year and a half and I have not had any infections etc for that long. Any info on this please ??? Or anyone else on the board I would welcome info shared. Thanks so much Jayne
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers 27-29 (For Dr. Leo)

Posts.Content: THIS QUESTION IS MOSTLY FOR LEO, (OR ANYONE ELSE WHO CAN ANSWER) CAN SCAR TISSUE DEVELOP SEVERAL YEARS AFTER SURGERY???? tHANKS SO MUCH
Posts.Title: SCAR TISSUE AFTER SEVERAL YEARS OF SURGERY

Posts.Content: Hi Rich, After my a/c was through I also developed carpal tunnel. My onc said it wasnt related to the drugs, and didnt say there was any connection, but I always felt it was. I had surgery to my right wrist and I also have it in my left but very minimal. The pain in my wrist was so bad during the middle of the night, I couldn't sleep. So I opted for the surgery, now the pain is gone. The best thing I ever could have done. Jayne
Posts.Title: Chemo and Carpal Tunnel related?

Posts.Content: Does anyone know if the PET scans can detect cancer in the lymph node areas as well as other parts of the body?? I read somewhere they should not be used for positive node determination. Thanks
Posts.Title: PET scans

Posts.Content: Hi Dr. Leo, I was dx with bone mets 3 months ago. Since then my tumors markers have gone down dramatically, my little bone pain that I had is gone. I went for a follow up bone scan, PET and CT of abdomen and pelvis. The bone scan showed increase in lesions, the Ct showed progression in lesion , but the PET is completely negative. My onc said this could be bone healing on the CT and bone scan. Do you have any input to possibly clarify this for me? Thank you so much
Posts.Title: Question for Dr. Leo please
